ai-snp1.7:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-snp1.7:1.3_0: Then the Buddha robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, entered Sāvatthī for alms.

ai-snp1.7:1.5_0: Then the Buddha was wandering indiscriminately for alms-food in Sāvatthī, where he approached the brahmin firewood.

ai-snp1.7:3.1_0: After this was said, the Fortunate One said this to the brahmin Aggikabhāradvāja:
ai-snp1.7:3.2_0: “But do you know whether an outcaste is, brahmin, or an outcaste?”
ai-snp1.7:3.3_0: “I don’t know what an outcaste is,
ai-snp1.7:3.4_0: Master Gotama, please teach me this matter so I can know what an outcaste is, and what can I say.”
ai-snp1.7:3.5_0: “Well then, brahmin, listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
